definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
erhua variant of 差一點|差一点[cha4 yi1 dian3]
hearts linked as one, just as the proverbial rhinoceros communicates emotion telepathically through his single horn (idiom); fig. two hearts beat as one
pinyin: xin1 you3 ling2 xi1 yi1 dian3 tong1

definition: a hint is all that is needed/understanding each other without the need to explain

pinyin: yi1 dian3 shui3 yi1 ge4 pao4
bu4 jian4 yi1 dian3 zong1 ying3

sentences.english: Don't eat up at one and you can have it after a while.
sentences.chinese: 别一下子全吃了，留一点过会儿再吃。

sentences.english: I can speake chinese only and I know a little simple English?
sentences.chinese: 我会说中文和一点简单的英语？

sentences.english: It's an exquisite book. You can see, it's not thick.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本好书，大家能看到，它一点也不厚。

sentences.english: In some extend, I am not a hypercritical person about food.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，我对于食物是一点都不挑剔的。
是的，我有一点点的神经质。

sentences.english: I have no idea what they are going to say, so I'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我一点不知道他们将会说什么，所以我只好见机行事。

sentences.english: The exchange rate fluctuates every day.
sentences.chinese: 今天的汇率比昨天稍微低一点儿。

sentences.english: So we need to recognize that.
My heart is not pain, but pain has long been numb.
sentences.chinese: 我的心一点也不痛，而是早已痛的麻木了。

sentences.english: it was actually the management training that the company provided. That was the bigger draw.
sentences.chinese: 但它提供了一个管理培训项目的这一点更加吸引我。

sentences.english: A little down? Do you mean move it down to the left?
sentences.chinese: 有点往下？你的意思是说把它往左边移下一点。

sentences.english: Of the original scheme hardly a wrack remains.
sentences.chinese: 原来的计划几乎一点残迹也未留下。

sentences.english: No one in the bar appears surprised to see a disabled person dancing.
sentences.chinese: 看到希福跳舞，酒吧里的人似乎一点都不吃惊。

sentences.english: We have to recognize it and lessen the impact best we can, " said Gore.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须认清这一点并尽可能减轻其影响，”戈尔说。

sentences.english: Should have a living environment of…
sentences.chinese: 搞西洋画的，生活环境也应该洋一点。

sentences.english: They knock each other off balance just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 她说，“他们只是一点点敲击彼此的不平衡之处。”

definition: erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er
Diandian (Chinese microblogging and social networking website)
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
